Select the account you wish to authorize:
A game by, Blind Faith Games
This application works on portrait mode.

This is a research project that tries to gather insight on how blind people play games on mobile devices and how developers could make games that are not only accessible, but also enjoyable for them. Select an interaction mode depending on if you have visual discapacity or not. To select make a long press to select an option

This is a research project that tries to gather insight on how blind people play games on mobile devices and how developers could make games that are not only accessible, but also enjoyable for them. Select an interaction mode depending on if you have visual discapacity or not. To select make a long press to select an option

In order to get a better game experience, we recommend you to download the "IVONA Text-to-Speech HQ" synthesizer. Blind Faith Games is not associated or have any relation with IVONA project but we think that is the best synthetizer. Would you like to install it?
Main menu Accessible Minesweeper, you can navigate through the menu by making simple taps in the different options and just make a long press to select one of the options below

Accessible Minesweeper, 2012. 


Accessible Minesweeper is part of Blind Faith Games (BFG), a research project about how to deliver eyes-free game experiences that are enjoyable on your Android™ device regardless of your sight capabilities. If you have some time to spare, please help us to improve the game by filling in the feedback form that can be reached from the main menu.


BFG is a project of the e-UCM research group, developed by Gloria Pozuelo and Javier Álvarez.
 e-UCM is a research group of the Department of Software Engineering and Artificial Intelligence at the Complutense University of Madrid.


More info at: http://blind-faith-games.e-ucm.es
 Contact us at: android@e-ucm.es 


Android is a trademark of Google Inc.
It shows text that contains the TTS speech
It adds one more touch to every screen touch event
Allows you to use the application without any visual reference in the game and main menu.

The board is a mesh of buttons and some of them hide a mine. Your goal is to find all of those mines, without detonating any of them.

 You can press any cell -dig mode- or mark it -exploration mode- with a flag, if you think it contains a mine. When you press a cell, several cells can be discovered, and they will show you how many mines are around them.

 

 Options: make use of the settings while you are in the main menu in order to turn on the Speech synthesizer as well as music.

To play Android Minesweeper there are several controls you should know:


Buttons, use:
 - menu button - to repeat the last synthetizer voice message
 - mute button - switch between exploration and dig mode
 - volume up button - turn on/off zoom mode
 - camera button - listen to controls hints
 - volume down key - listen to cell coordinates
 - search button - listen to the cell context information, that is, you will listen at every cell information, that surround the selected one, beginning at the top cell and ending at the top left cell in clockwise order.


If you don't have any of this buttons, you can change them, by making a simple tap on Key Configurations.


Play with touch screen, use:
 - one tap, to select a cell
 - two taps, to dig a cell
 - three taps, to explore a cell
 - drag, to listen different features of the cell


Play with keyboard, use:
 - arrows, to select a cell
 - enter button or similar, to dig or explore


While in zoom mode, enter button or tap to dig or explore.
We recommend you to download the "IVONA Text-to-Speech HQ" synthesizer

Menu settings. By tapping on each element on this menu changes and reads an option. Particular in this menu you can find two profile options\: A and B whose activation enables another options on the menu. Of course, you can continue enabling independently all option on the menu. You will find the next options on this menu\:

Key Configuration. By tapping on your left you could listen the action descriptions and by tapping on your right you will change the key related by an action. If you are in blind interaction mode you have to do a long click to be able to change the configuration. You have the next options\:
To repeat last sinthetizer voice message
You have to complete the form
You have changed the key associated with

You can navigate through this form menu by making long taps on the buttons next and previous situated below of each option set or text. If you click on a text or a button its text will be read and, important!! if it\'s a answer button will be selected.
In this case, if you want, you can write in a field your opinion about the application.
From now on, making taps, you can choose between different answers to respond questions.
You can fill this field with your opinion.

This is a research project that tries to gather insight on how blind people play games on mobile devices and how developers could make games that are not only accessible, but also enjoyable for them. To fulfill these goals, we would like to know some details about you and how you interact with technologies in general and games in particular. This will help us to interpret your answers to this questionnaire. All the information collected through this questionnaire will be anonymous, untraceable and will be treated confidentially and only used for the purpose of the study. \n
Mark the option that better describes your current visual level
Rate how often you play games in your computer or game console. Where 1 means "Never" and 5 "very often"
Rate how often you play games in your mobile device (phone or tablet). Where 1 means "Never" and 5 "very often"
Please rate how easy/difficult it was to learn to play. Where 1 means "very difficult" and 5 "very easy".
Rate how fun it was to play. Where 1 means "very boring" and 5 "very fun".
Rate how engaging was the game. Where 1 means "not engaging" and 5 "very engaging".
Rate how pleasant or frustrating was the interaction with the game. Where 1 means "very frustrating" and 5 "very pleasant".
Rate how you liked the story and narrative atmosphere (if applicable). Where 1 means "I didn\'t like it at all" and 5 "I liked it very much".
Rate how you liked the accessibility and control settings. Where 1 means "I didn\'t like it at all" and 5 "I liked it very much".
Rate how you liked the feedback provide by the game. Where 1 means "I didn\'t like it at all" and 5 "I liked it very much".
Finally, please provide any comments or suggestions to improve the game. Then tap on "Finish" to send the responses to us, and that\'s all!
To go to the next tip, make a simple tap on the top of the screen.
To finish the tutorial, make a simple tap on the top of the screen.
In this tutorial, you will learn the game basics.
You can make a simple tap on the screen to select a cell and to listen its state. Try to do it now!.
You can make a double tap on the screen to dig a cell. Try to do it now!.
You can make a triple tap on the screen to explore a non pushed cell or to non explore a explored cell. Try to do it now!.
You will be able to check out how to change the selected cell using drag events. Check it out!

In Accessible Minesweeper you can assign some keys to some actions. Some of them are:
 Instructions reading: To remember how to play, use the Camera by default.
 Coordinates: To read the cell state and coordinates, use the volume down key by default. 
 The most complex actions like Zoom mode, exploration mode or Read cell context are explained in tutorial next steps Now, try to use them!.

Zoom mode allows you to select a cell in a easier way than the normal mode, by tapping on the center of the screen. If you make a tap in some of the screen ends you will be changing the focused cell. Remember to make only one tap!. Moreover, the way of interact changes. Now you have to do a tap to dig a cell and a double tap to flag a cell To enable the zoom mode you can use the key Volume Up by default. Now, try to use it!.
Exploration mode allows you to flag cells independently of the event, by making double or triple tap. To enable the exploration mode you can use the key Volume Mute by default. Try it now.
It\'s an additional option that reads the cells states around the focused cell. To read cells you can use the search button by default. Try it now!.
Great! you have digged various cells.
There is a cell change. Current cell
Your screen has turned on. May be you have to unlock your device.
Playing \'The other side of the door\'
